title: Perform basic arithmetic operations
description: As a General User, I want to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division using a clear interface, so that I can accurately and efficiently solve basic mathematical problems.
business_value: Establishes the core, non-negotiable functionality of the calculator, serving as the foundation for all other features and providing the primary value proposition to the user.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Correct Order of Operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS)","given":"The user has entered the expression '5+3×2'","when":"The user triggers the calculation","then":"The result '11' is displayed, correctly performing multiplication before addition."},{"scenario":"Calculation with Decimal and Negative Numbers","given":"The user has entered the expression '1.5 × -10'","when":"The user triggers the calculation","then":"The result '-15' is displayed."},{"scenario":"Division by Zero","given":"The user has entered the expression '8÷0'","when":"The user triggers the calculation","then":"A clear, non-destructive error message 'Cannot divide by zero' is displayed, and the original input '8÷0' is preserved."}]
technical_tasks: ["Integrate a third-party math library (e.g., math.js) to handle expression parsing and evaluation.","Develop the main calculator keypad and display components using React and Material-UI.","Implement logic to ensure standard order of operations (PEMDAS) is respected.","Implement robust error handling for invalid operations like division by zero."]
definition_of_done: ["Unit tests for the calculation logic achieve >90% code coverage.","The calculator UI is fully responsive and passes WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility checks.","All calculations and UI updates complete in under 50ms.","E2E tests for addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and order of operations are passing."]

title: Register for a new user account
description: As a prospective user, I want to create a secure personal account using my email and a strong password, so that I can save my calculation history, custom variables, and user-created modes.
business_value: Enables user-specific data persistence, which increases user retention and engagement. It is the foundational feature for all personalized functionality.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful registration with valid credentials","given":"I am an unauthenticated user on the registration page","when":"I enter a valid email, a strong password, confirm the password, accept the ToS, and click 'Register'","then":"My account is created, I am automatically logged in, and I am redirected to the main calculator view with a welcome message."},{"scenario":"Registration attempt with an existing email","given":"I am on the registration page","when":"I enter an email address that already exists in the system and submit the form","then":"The form submission is rejected, and an error message 'This email address is already in use.' is displayed."},{"scenario":"Registration attempt with a weak password","given":"I am on the registration page","when":"I enter a password that does not meet the system's security policy","then":"The form submission is rejected, and an informative error message is displayed detailing the password requirements."}]
technical_tasks: ["Create React components for the user registration form using Material-UI.","Implement client-side validation for all fields, including password strength and ToS acceptance.","Integrate with AWS Cognito using the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code flow with PKCE.","Manage authentication state (tokens, user info) in a dedicated Redux Toolkit slice."]
definition_of_done: ["E2E test for the happy path registration flow is implemented and passing.","UI is responsive and meets WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards.","Security review completed for token handling and API interactions.","AWS Cognito User Pool is configured via Terraform with the required password policy."]

title: View a history of previous calculations
description: As a user, I want to see a scrollable list of my recent calculations and their results so that I can review my work, with my history being saved to my account if I am logged in.
business_value: Improves core usability by allowing users to reference past work. For registered users, persistent history is a key feature that encourages account creation and increases user retention.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Adding a new calculation to the history","given":"A user has the calculator open","when":"The user successfully performs a calculation (e.g., '2+2' which results in '4')","then":"A new entry appears at the top of the history list, displaying both the expression ('2+2') and the result ('4')."},{"scenario":"Registered user's history is loaded upon login","given":"A registered user with a pre-existing calculation history is logged out","when":"The user successfully logs in to their account","then":"The history panel is populated with the user's calculation history fetched from the backend."},{"scenario":"Anonymous user's history is cleared on session end","given":"An anonymous user has a populated calculation history","when":"The user performs a hard refresh (F5) of the browser tab","then":"The calculation history is cleared, and the panel shows the empty state message."}]
technical_tasks: ["Create a scrollable React component for the history panel.","Implement logic for session-based (anonymous) history using local state or session storage.","Integrate with backend API to fetch and display persisted history for logged-in users.","Implement offline queuing for history items created while disconnected."]
definition_of_done: ["E2E tests cover both anonymous and registered user history flows.","The history panel UI correctly handles empty, populated, scrolling, and error states.","Offline synchronization behavior is verified for history items.","The component is fully accessible, using semantic HTML for the list."]

title: Persist calculation history across sessions for registered users
description: As a registered user, I want my calculation history to be automatically saved to my account so that I can access it from any device at any time, ensuring my work is never lost.
business_value: Increases user retention and encourages account registration by transforming the application from a stateless tool into a persistent, multi-device workspace.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"User's history is loaded upon login","given":"I am a registered user with a pre-existing calculation history","when":"I open the application and log in","then":"An API request is made to fetch my calculation history and the history panel is populated."},{"scenario":"History is synchronized across different devices/sessions","given":"I am logged in on my desktop and perform a new calculation","when":"I then log in to my account on my mobile device","then":"The calculation I performed on my desktop is visible in the history panel on my mobile device."},{"scenario":"Calculations made while offline are queued and synced upon reconnection","given":"I am a logged-in user and my internet connection is lost","when":"I perform one or more calculations and then reconnect","then":"The offline calculations are successfully saved to my account and merged with the server's list."}]
technical_tasks: ["Develop NestJS API endpoints (GET, POST) for `/api/v1/history`.","Create a TypeORM entity and database migration for the 'calculation_history' table.","Implement a JWT guard to protect endpoints and ensure a user can only access their own history.","Integrate the frontend history feature with the new API endpoints using RTK Query."]
definition_of_done: ["API endpoints are documented in the auto-generated OpenAPI specification.","API integration tests verify data segregation between different users.","E2E tests confirm that history is correctly saved and loaded across sessions.","P95 API response time for fetching history is under 200ms."]

title: Automatically sync offline data upon reconnection
description: As a registered user with an intermittent internet connection, I want the application to automatically save changes I make while offline and sync them to my account when I reconnect, so that my data is safe and available across all my devices.
business_value: Increases user trust, data integrity, and application reliability. Reduces user friction and potential data loss, enhancing the professional quality of the product.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Sync new calculation history created while offline","given":"I am a logged-in user, and my device loses its internet connection","when":"I perform new calculations and then my connection is restored","then":"The application automatically initiates a sync process, and the new history items are saved to my account."},{"scenario":"Conflict resolution for variable update using last-write-wins","given":"I update variable 'gamma' to 90 on Device B (offline), after it was updated to 110 on Device A (online)","when":"Device B reconnects to the internet","then":"The system resolves the conflict by accepting the server's version (110) as authoritative, and my UI on Device B updates to show 110."},{"scenario":"System gracefully handles synchronization failure","given":"I have pending offline changes queued","when":"I reconnect, and the sync attempt fails due to a server error","then":"The pending changes are retained in the local queue, and the application schedules a retry attempt."}]
technical_tasks: ["Implement a service using IndexedDB to queue API requests that fail due to network issues.","Develop a 'Sync Manager' that listens for network status changes to process the IndexedDB queue.","Implement 'last-write-wins' and 'append-only' conflict resolution strategies on the backend.","Create non-blocking UI indicators to inform the user of the current sync status."]
definition_of_done: ["E2E tests successfully simulate going offline, modifying data, reconnecting, and verifying the data is synced.","A dedicated E2E test demonstrates that the 'last-write-wins' conflict resolution works as specified.","The application remains performant and does not block the UI during the sync process.","The IndexedDB queue is correctly cleared upon successful synchronization."]

title: Create a new custom calculation mode via a guided wizard
description: As a registered user, I want to start a guided, step-by-step process to create a new custom calculation mode, so that I can build personalized tools that automate my recurring calculations.
business_value: Enables the core user-extensible functionality, increasing user engagement and retention by allowing users to create personalized tools, transforming the product into a customizable platform.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Initiate wizard and complete the first step successfully","given":"I am a logged-in user on the 'Custom Mode Management' screen","when":"I click 'Create New Mode', enter a unique name and an optional description, and click 'Next'","then":"The system validates the inputs, and I am taken to the next step of the wizard ('Define Variables')."},{"scenario":"Attempt to create a mode with a non-unique name","given":"I am creating a new mode and a mode with the name 'Resistor Network Solver' already exists","when":"I enter 'Resistor Network Solver' into the 'Name' field","then":"I see an inline error message stating 'A mode with this name already exists.'"},{"scenario":"Cancel the creation process","given":"I am in the middle of the custom mode creation wizard","when":"I click the 'Cancel' button and confirm my choice","then":"The wizard closes, I am returned to the 'Custom Mode Management' screen, and no new mode is saved."}]
technical_tasks: ["Build a reusable, multi-step wizard component framework in React.","Implement the first step of the wizard for defining the mode's name and description, including client-side validation.","Integrate with the backend API to save the final custom mode definition.","Manage the draft state of the mode being created across wizard steps using Redux Toolkit."]
definition_of_done: ["E2E tests for the happy path and key error conditions (e.g., duplicate name) are passing.","The wizard UI is fully responsive and accessible per WCAG 2.1 AA.","The backend API for creating a mode is protected, validated, and documented.","The wizard state is preserved when navigating between steps."]

title: Launch and use a custom calculation mode
description: As a registered user who has created a custom mode, I want to launch that mode, enter my input values, and see the results calculated automatically, so that I can efficiently solve my unique problems.
business_value: Actualizes the core value of the user-extensible framework by making user-created tools functional. This drives user engagement by making the application indispensable for their specific workflows.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Perform a successful calculation","given":"I am viewing a launched custom mode with all required input fields","when":"I enter valid numerical values into all input fields and trigger the calculation","then":"A secure API call is made to the backend formula execution service, and the output fields are populated with the correct results."},{"scenario":"Handle calculation errors from the backend","given":"I am viewing a custom mode with a formula that can result in a mathematical error (e.g., division by zero)","when":"I enter a value that will cause an error and trigger the calculation","then":"The API returns a structured error, a user-friendly error message is displayed, and my original input values are preserved."},{"scenario":"Calculation response time meets performance requirements","given":"I am using a custom mode with a moderately complex formula","when":"I trigger a calculation","then":"The total time from triggering the calculation to the result being displayed has a P95 of less than 500ms."}]
technical_tasks: ["Develop the secure AWS Lambda function using `isolated-vm` for sandboxed formula execution.","Create the backend API endpoint (`/execute`) to orchestrate the process: fetch mode definition, invoke Lambda, and return the result.","Build a dynamic form renderer in React that creates a UI from a mode's JSON definition.","Implement UI for handling inputs, loading states, and displaying results or errors."]
definition_of_done: ["Performance testing confirms the P95 latency for the execution endpoint is under 500ms.","A security review of the `isolated-vm` sandbox implementation is completed and approved.","E2E test successfully launches a custom mode, enters data, and verifies the calculated result.","The dynamic UI is fully accessible and responsive."]

title: Calculate Ohm's Law and Power values
description: As an electronics practitioner, I want to enter any two known values for Voltage, Current, Resistance, or Power, so that the calculator automatically computes the remaining two values.
business_value: Provides a core, high-utility feature for the target electronics audience, increasing the application's value proposition by simplifying a common and critical calculation.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Calculate Resistance and Power from Voltage and Current","given":"The user is in the Ohm's Law & Power mode","when":"The user enters a valid Voltage (e.g., '12V') and a valid Current (e.g., '500mA')","then":"The Resistance field is automatically calculated as '24Ω' and the Power field is calculated as '6W'."},{"scenario":"Calculate Current and Power from Voltage and Resistance","given":"The user is in the Ohm's Law & Power mode","when":"The user enters a valid Voltage (e.g., '5V') and a valid Resistance (e.g., '1kΩ')","then":"The Current field is automatically calculated as '5mA' and the Power field is calculated as '25mW'."},{"scenario":"Insufficient input for calculation","given":"The user is in the Ohm's Law & Power mode","when":"The user has entered a value in only one field","then":"The other three fields remain empty and a message 'Enter any two values to calculate.' is displayed."}]
technical_tasks: ["Create a React component with four interconnected input fields for V, I, R, and P.","Implement the client-side logic that correctly identifies which two values are known and calculates the remaining two for all 6 possible combinations.","Integrate the shared utility for parsing SI prefixes on inputs.","Ensure the component is responsive and accessible."]
definition_of_done: ["Component tests cover all 6 valid input combinations and produce correct results.","The UI correctly provides guidance when fewer than two inputs are entered.","The component is fully responsive and passes all WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility checks.","All calculations and UI updates complete in under 50ms."]

title: Ensure Full Application Compatibility with Screen Readers

acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Dynamic Content and Calculation Results Announcement","given":"The user has entered a valid expression into the calculator input field","when":"The user activates the 'Equals' button","then":"The screen reader must immediately announce the updated result (e.g., 'Result: 15')."},{"scenario":"Form Interaction and Validation Feedback","given":"The user is in the 'Custom Mode' creation wizard and has left a required field empty","when":"The user attempts to proceed to the next step","then":"The screen reader must announce the validation error (e.g., 'Alert: Mode Name is a required field')."},{"scenario":"Full Keyboard Operability","given":"Any view of the application is active","when":"The user attempts to access any interactive element or feature","then":"It must be possible to do so using only the keyboard (Tab, Shift+Tab, Enter, Space) with no keyboard traps."}]
technical_tasks: ["Audit all React components to ensure the use of semantic HTML5 elements.","Implement correct ARIA roles, states, and properties for all custom and dynamic components.","Implement ARIA live regions to announce dynamic UI updates like calculation results and error messages.","Ensure a logical focus order and implement focus trapping for all modal dialogs.","Integrate automated accessibility testing tools (e.g., Axe) into the E2E test suite."]
definition_of_done: ["The application passes a full WCAG 2.1 Level AA audit with no critical or serious violations.","All features are fully operable using only a keyboard and a screen reader (tested with NVDA and VoiceOver).","Automated accessibility checks are integrated into the CI pipeline and are passing.","A formal accessibility testing checklist is created and added to project documentation."]
